meanings.definition: To give a sentence or punishment to someone before a trial or hearing.
meanings.sent1: The judge presentenced the criminal to community service before the trial.
meanings.sent2: The court presentenced the suspect to house arrest until the hearing.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly presentenced the student to extra homework for talking in class.
meanings.sent4: The strict coach presentenced the team to extra practice for their poor performance.
meanings.sent5: The principal presentenced the troublemaker to a week of detention as a consequence.

meanings.definition: To have already given a sentence or punishment to someone.
meanings.sent1: She had presentenced the thief to jail time before the trial even began.
meanings.sent2: The authorities had presentenced the vandal to pay a fine for the damages.
meanings.sent3: The parents had presentenced their children to no TV for a week as a punishment.
meanings.sent4: The judge had presentenced the repeat offender to a longer prison term.
meanings.sent5: The committee had presentenced the rule-breaker to a public apology as a consequence.
